Pros: Bolt has a big vision, bringing frictionless shopping experiences to millions of shoppers worldwide by allowing shoppers to be recognized. The people at Bolt are highly motivated and exceptional to work with.
Cons: Bolt is still a startup, and pivots are frequent. We do a lot of experimentation and are aggressively trying to find our way to scale. If this sounds a little too uncomfortable, we may recognize it may not be the best environment for every personality.

Pros:
Interviewing with Bolt consisted of 4-5 conversations with leaders and stakeholders I'd be working alongside on a daily basis/supporting. Interviewers were engaging and it was a very positive experience overall. 

Once hired, onboarding took about 1-2 weeks and was very organized. Had more than enough support in terms of both materials and colleagues to get up to speed on Bolt's product, culture, etc. 
Pay and benefits are strong - company is remote-first, Pay is competitive (at/above industry average), and benefits are in alignment with other tech companies in the space. 

Despite previous re-structures and changes in the organization the last few years, leaders are/have been transparent about the changes, the reasons behind them, and the vision/plan for Bolt moving forward. 

Product is interesting and a disrupter in the e-commerce space. You'll have the opportunity to work on/support the development of a product that supports well known brands everyone knows which is cool. 

There have been changes in leadership recently, and as a new hire, it seems from both a company vision/GTM strategy, as well as an employee morale standpoint, they are for the better. Individual contributors and leaders alike are aligned on the vision for the company and the product moving forward and are making a concerted effort to create a culture of more communication, transparency, and openness within all aspects of the organization. 

Definitely a startup culture where they prioritize hiring individuals who are able to/enjoy working autonomously, are strong culture builders, optimistic, and take ownership and accountability on the work they contribute. While there are more than enough systems/processes put in place, you also will have the opportunity to create processes from scratch or iterate on them. This may not be for everyone, but if you enjoy working in a high growth/scrappy startup environment, you will likely enjoy the type of work you get to do here.
Cons: Because of the multiple changes that have been made in the last 6-12 months, there may be some people that may not be aligned with the new vision/strategy of the company or new leadership moving forward. That being said, leadership has made a concerted effort to address this misalignment head on and have candid conversations about the future rather than not addressing people's apprehensions. From everything I've seen, department leaders and the executive team have taken a very humanistic approach to addressing people's concerns, and you can/will be heard and seen as a valued member of the Bolt organization.

Pros: There is a lot of opportunity to roll up your sleeves and take on ownership that influence the strategic direction of the business. Bolt is going through a transformational shift and has great people in place across the board to help drive that. This is a great time to join if you like building, owning your domain, and innovating.
Cons: Bolt moves fast, there is no question about it. Often times, moving fast means things break. It's expected in a startup, but sometimes there are pieces to pick up and fix/solve when the company moves so quickly.
